OECD AI Capability Indicators

This document introduces the OECD AI Capability Indicators, a framework designed to assess and compare nations' capabilities in artificial intelligence. It‚Äôs published under the responsibility of the OECD Secretary-General and represents the views of member countries, not necessarily official stances. The document emphasizes neutrality regarding territorial disputes, explicitly stating that data and maps are presented without prejudice to the status of territories like the Golan Heights, East Jerusalem, and Israeli settlements in the West Bank, adhering to international law. The note from the European Union Member States clarifies that the Republic of Cyprus is recognized by all members of the EU. The document‚Äôs purpose is to provide a standardized approach to understanding AI development across different countries, while carefully navigating sensitive geopolitical considerations. The inclusion of caveats regarding data sources and territorial claims highlights the inherent challenges in collecting and interpreting data related to AI development, particularly in regions with ongoing political tensions. The document‚Äôs careful wording demonstrates the OECD‚Äôs commitment to impartiality and responsible data presentation, acknowledging the complexities surrounding the ‚ÄòCyprus issue‚Äô and the need for a lasting, equitable solution within the framework of the United Nations. The overall aim is to facilitate informed discussion and comparison of AI capabilities, recognizing the significant impact of political and geographical factors on technological advancement.

Key Concepts:

  • OECD AI Capability Indicators framework
  • Dispute over Cyprus (Greek Cypriot vs. Turkish Cypriot)
  • Recognition of the Republic of Cyprus

  • UN-mediated solution for the Cyprus issue
  • Development of AI towards full human equivalence
  • Evidence-based framework for understanding AI capabilities
  • Comparison of AI capabilities to human abilities
  • Impacts of AI on human activities
